Message.Msg: Thanks and the same to you. Peace out.
Yes, I know proxy servers. But having the address narrows the search. What they have given my E-Mail address to also tells me something about them.
I've never threatened anyone on these boards. I have stated I intend to find whom ever is putting personal information about me on this board.

Topic.Title: Now it is official: America needs more gun control

Message.Msg: Who says to disarm officers, no one. Guns kill, period. Put guns in schools, the gun nut like the one who started a fire to draw firefighters to kill them, will just move on to a theater, mall, or other place. Your arguments are nuts.

"He was caught with burglary tools, and stolen goods" Is that worthy of a death penalty sentence carried out by a vigilante, in your warped little brain? Even though it is probably a lie, but let's say it isn't. Your arguments are nuts, all of them.

Topic.Title: Now it is official: America needs more gun control

Message.Msg: Two firefighters ambushed and killed by a gun nut. Solution: all firefighters have assault weapons, and shoot whoever they see at the fire first, before they shoot back. Women, children, no matter mow them all down like a good gun nut would, to protect. Idiots, all of you gun nuts..

Topic.Title: Now it is official: America needs more gun control

Message.Msg: "The biggest mass school killing in US was done with explosives back in 1927" Since that time legislation has been adopted that makes it very difficult for people to obtain explosives. It is still very easy to get an AR-15. These have become the weapon of choice for every petty criminal or nutcase out there. They are cheap, easy to use, easy to get and they kill alot of people in a short period of time. You are trying to make the case that a country with a citizenry armed to the teeth is safer and more free than one that is not saturated with arms. That argument simply does not hold up to reason or the evidence. If you want to make the case that a certain number of innocent people dying each year is a price worth paying to have access to guns, that is one thing. But America is not safer or freer with easy access to assault rifles. Just look at Mexico. With the weaponry available to our own drug gangs, we should be glad the worst thing we've had to deal with is the occasional lunatic. "I believe almost 20% of all high schools already have some type of armed officer, so expanding the program to include all schools is not a reach." Our elementary schools should not require armed guards. A society in which we require armed guards in our schools is the exact society we are trying to prevent. You should be clear on this. Armed schools are not a solution. Every school with an armed guard represents a failure. You seriously have to question the sanity of people who are willing to pay billions to put guns in schools but not teachers. This is what "conservatism" has been reduced to.
Martin was a teenage kid. Zimmerman is another fool I don't want to have access to an AR-15.

Message.Title: Retailer Federal Bailout
Message.Msg: I can see it coming. Reason? Fiscal cliff uncertainty.

""According to a new poll, most Americans think Santa Claus is a Democrat – which is really odd because when I think of a fat, old white man who hires unskilled labor, I think Republican." – Conan O’Brien" Even Conan agrees: when it comes to GIVING people jobs, one thinks Republican!!!!

Yeah. Pay for your stuff. I'm sure, thirty years in the future, there will be plenty of people my age ending long and successful careers at Chrysler & GM, their supplier companies, and their dealers. Like you, many of them will claim they don't have to pay for their stuff because they never got anything from government. That's what public investment in the economy is all about. It is not about saving the offshore accounts of bondholders who invest in failing companies, assuming the government will bail them out. You invest in AT&T, I assume. Do you really think the success of your investment in a PUBLIC utility company does not depend on government?

Message.Msg: In addition to its commitment to diversity in regards to age, economic background, ethnicity, gender, physical disability, political affiliation, race and sexual orientation it also has 11 armed guards in addition to a compliment of secret service agents. No wonder David Gregory and other members of the D.C. 1 percent have selected this school as good place to send their children. It truely is a shame that the average American doesn't understand what our "dear leaders" are talking about when they tell us about the virtues of doing away with the second amendment. Maybe someday the great unwashed will finally get the big picture. In your heart you know he is right, The Frogg

While their people lived a bare existence they lived like the rajahs of old. They even had a store just for themselves that stocked things that only they could buy. "Lefties" have always been frauds and liars.
Then you're a fool. You should know the basics of the industries you invest in.

Topic.Title: Sidwell Friends School sounds like a very safe place for children

Message.Msg: Are you daft? Because wealthy people in a capitalist country can afford expensive private schools the capitalists are communists? You finally talk about equality of opportunity in our schools, and it's the opportunity to bring a gun. But alas, the capitalists you describe, buying privilege for their children, are acting like capitalists, not communists. George Orwell was a Democratic Socialist. He was one of a small but important number of Socialists who did not let ideology blind them to the reality of totalitarian Communism. He was a brutally honest critic of power, and a vehement advocate for causes he supported, but was ultimately a moderate. He is one of my political heroes and in my own writing and actions I hope to emulate him. If you think he'd agree with the likes of you on anything, think again. "No question now what had happened to the faces of the pigs. The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which." George Orwell, Animal Farm In other words, if you think Obama is a socialist, then by sending his children to an expensive private school he is a socialist acting like a capitalist, not a socialist acting like a socialist.

Topic.Title: Sidwell Friends School sounds like a very safe place for children

Message.Msg: Dear Ricky, I was attempting to point out the intellecual dishonesty of those on the left (Mr. Gregory) who spent 30 minutes on his TV show (Meet The Press) attempting to discredit conservatives for having the temerity to desire the same level of security enjoyed by Mr. Gregory's children and the children of our "dear leader". Sorry if it wasn't clear. As far as the quote "In your heart..." I believe most conservatives know the quote, and if you dig a little you will probably be able to identify the source. Happy hunting The Frogg

"every thing the government gives to people is what they have taken away from other people" Actually, that's what I'm shooting for. That is not what is happening. Much of what the government gives people is financed by debt. Much of the money the government spends is spent on interest on that debt. My goal is that whatever the government spends is financed by taxes, not debt. I think that is the best way to moderate spending. This is in contrast to "Starve the Beast" philosophy of Norquist, which encourages deficit spending in hopes of bankrupting the government.

A public utility is any private corporation granted a geographic monopoly (or something like it) by the government. It is a response to a particular set of economic circumstances--it has nothing to do with basic services or "essentials". It is simply inefficient to have multiple competing sewer systems, railroad systems, road systems, transmission line systems, telephone line systems, aviation systems, that do not connect to each other. This is why the government does these things. Sometimes it does it itself (roads) and sometimes it grants geographic monopolies to private companies (power companies) and sometimes it grants geographic monopolies and cooperative arrangements for managing and sharing infrastructure and costs while competing over that infrastructure (telephone lines). Generally for phones, the legacy wired lines are the "public utilities". But imagine if your wireless AT&T phone could not communicate with Verizon phones, or if Verizon tried to muscle out T-mobile by blocking calls. It is the government that makes sure that doesn't happen and that we have competition from upstarts like T-mobile to push the larger carriers. It is doubtful that wireless communication would have advanced as far as it has without government regulating competition over the public airwaves. I hope you guys have your money with managers.
